result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy Lee Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Timothy Lee Harris is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Timothy Lee Harris was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Plea and Sentencing Hearing on 5-17-17 filed by court reporter Marjorie Kurtz

Cases called: 15CF347 and 16CF554, Defendant Timothy Lee Harris in court, in custody with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim notification complied with. In 15CF347, Court sentenced defendant to 3 years prison, consisting of 1 year confinement & 2 years extended supervision. Conditions: pay all unpaid court-ordered obligations. Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety.  Complete domestic abuse counseling and follow all recommendations. DNA sample if not provided. Defendant not eligible for Challenge Academy, is eligible for the Substance Abuse program. Court granted 176 days jail credit.  In 16CF554 - Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 2. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence with held, 1 year probation, consecutive to 15CF347. Conditions: $543 costs. Maintain absolute sobriety. Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Complete domestic abuse counseling and follow all recommendations. Submit DNA sample. $102.07 restitution, $112.28 total with surcharge. All remaining counts read in and dismissed. No jail credit.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 17, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 25, 2017 at 11:30 am.
